summary: This is a memorandum opinion and order by Judge Alison J. Nathan in the Ghislaine Maxwell criminal case, ruling on the government's motion to preclude the expert testimony of Dr. Ryan Hall. The court precludes Dr. Hall from testifying as an expert about psychological diagnoses of 'Alleged Victim 4' due to lack of probative value and risk of unfair prejudice, but reserves judgment on his potential fact testimony regarding prior inconsistent statements.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case, subject of the court's rulings on expert testimony.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: Author of the memorandum opinion and order, ruling on the admissibility of expert testimony.

persons.name: Park Dietz
persons.context: One of eight expert witnesses noticed by the defense, expected to rebut opinions of the government's expert.

persons.name: Elizabeth Loftus
persons.context: One of eight expert witnesses noticed by the defense, expected to rebut opinions of the government's expert.

persons.name: Lisa Rocchio
persons.context: Government's expert witness whose opinions Dr. Dietz and Dr. Loftus are expected to rebut.

persons.name: Ryan Hall
persons.context: Defense-retained psychiatrist whose expert testimony about psychological diagnoses of 'Alleged Victim 4' is precluded by the court.

connections.description: Dr. Hall was retained by the defense to evaluate 'Alleged Victim 4' and potentially testify as an expert witness in Maxwell's trial.
Both are defense expert witnesses noticed to rebut the government's expert, Dr. Lisa Rocchio.
Dr. Dietz is expected to offer opinions rebutting those of the government's expert, Dr. Rocchio.
Dr. Loftus is expected to offer opinions rebutting those of the government's expert, Dr. Rocchio.
Dr. Hall conducted a psychiatric evaluation of 'Alleged Victim 4' and produced a report with diagnoses.

events.title: Defense Notices Expert Witnesses
events.description: The defense notices eight expert witnesses, including Dr. Park Dietz, Dr. Elizabeth Loftus, and Dr. Ryan Hall.

events.title: Government Moves to Preclude Dietz and Loftus
events.description: The government files a motion to partially preclude the testimony of Dr. Dietz and Dr. Loftus.

events.title: Government Moves to Preclude Six Experts
events.description: The government moves to fully or partially preclude the testimony of the remaining six defense experts, including Dr. Hall.

events.title: Defense Files Response
events.description: The defense files a response to the government's motion to preclude expert testimony.

events.title: Court Issues Order Precluding Dr. Hall's Expert Testimony
events.description: Judge Alison J. Nathan issues an order granting the government's motion to preclude Dr. Ryan Hall's expert testimony on psychological diagnoses.

keyFacts: The court precluded defense expert Dr. Ryan Hall from testifying about psychological diagnoses of 'Alleged Victim 4', finding the diagnoses (over 12 years old) had little probative value and risked unfair prejudice under Rules 401 and 403.

Dr. Hall's report indicated 'Alleged Victim 4' did not identify Ghislaine Maxwell as a perpetrator of abuse during his evaluation, a point the defense may seek to introduce as a prior inconsistent statement.
The court will permit cross-examination of 'Alleged Victim 4' about substance use during and after the alleged events, but not Dr. Hall's expert diagnosis of substance abuse disorders.
The ruling is a pretrial decision; the defense may re-raise the request to admit Dr. Hall's expert testimony if facts at trial alter the court's analysis.
The document references other defense experts (Drs. Dietz and Loftus) and a government expert (Dr. Rocchio), showing the battle over expert testimony in the case.
